title: 110_hr4933
content: The Act may be cited as the "Captive Wildlife Safety Technical Amendments Act of 2008" and includes amendments related to captive wildlife safety. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 are updated to include new prohibited acts related to captive wildlife offenses, such as importing, exporting, transporting, selling, or receiving captive wildlife. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 prohibit various acts related to captive wildlife, including importing, exporting, transporting, selling, receiving, acquiring, or purchasing live animals of prohibited wildlife species in interstate or foreign commerce. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 prohibit acts related to prohibited wildlife species, including importing, exporting, transporting, selling, receiving, acquiring, or purchasing live animals in interstate or foreign commerce. The amendments also specify changes in the classification of animals listed in section 2(g) to be referred to as prohibited wildlife species. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 prohibit various acts related to prohibited wildlife species, including importing, exporting, transporting, selling, receiving, acquiring, or purchasing live animals in interstate or foreign commerce. Amendments also specify changes in the classification of animals listed in section 2(g) as prohibited wildlife species. Additionally, amendments involve adjustments in fiscal years for certain provisions. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 expand civil and criminal penalties for violations, including changes to subsections and sections related to prohibited wildlife species. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 expand penalties for violations related to prohibited wildlife species, including changes to subsections and sections. Amendment (d) corrects a prior error in Public Law 100-653 by updating references to subsections in section 3. The Captive Wildlife Safety Act was amended to remove subsection (b) and revise subsection (a) by removing unnecessary wording. The amendment was passed by the House of Representatives on March 31, 2008.
